IMeshDictionary Interface Reference
[MESH+ Module]

import "meshplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IMeshDictionary:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

MESH+ Bone Dictionary (auxiliary class).

Simple, auxiliary class supporting IMesh with numerical synonims for bone names. The dictionaries are created automatically by the ISceneObject and then passed to IMesh objects, thus they are rarely used directly.

Remarks:
Call GetIndex to get a unique index for a given string. First, the dictionary tries to substitute the given string with its synonym, if any has been set.
See also:
IMesh::SupportBlendWeight

Implementation in FreeWillPlus::MeshDictionary

Definition at line 413 of file meshplus.idl.

Public Member Functions

Dictionary of Words into Integers
Produces unique numerical ids for each distinguishable string.
Strings not found in the dictionary are assigned to a new consecutive id.
The strings are first substituted by their Synonyms, if any exists (see below)

HRESULT GetNum ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the number of items in the dictionary.

HRESULT GetName ([in] FWULONG i,[out, retval] LPOLESTR *)
 Returns the string Name at the given id (FW_E_BADINDEX if out of range).

HRESULT GetIndex ([in] LPOLESTR pName,[out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the index for the given string Name, creates a new entry for new names.

HRESULT GetIndexIfExists ([in] LPOLESTR pName,[out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the index for the given string Name, returns S_FALSE for non-existing names.

The Dictionary of Synonyms
Provides string synonyms for string names.
Used as a pre-processing level for the Word into Integer dictionary (see above)

HRESULT PutSynonim ([in] LPOLESTR pFor,[in] LPOLESTR pSynonim)
 Puts a new synonym pair.

HRESULT GetSynonim ([in] LPOLESTR pFor,[out, retval] LPOLESTR *)
 Gets a synonim pair, returns the same word if no synonym known.

HRESULT GetSynonimNum ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Retrieves number of synonym pairs.

HRESULT GetSynonimAt ([in] FWULONG *pi,[out] LPOLESTR *,[out, retval] LPOLESTR *)
 Retrieve the synonym pair at the given index (FW_E_BADINDEX if out of range).
